comments_since_last_sample.body: Lads. It's eidos. Why were you even expecting good performance.  They are a b tier dev at best.

This story was amazing.
Really loved Gamora, starlord and drax. I really cared in the end about these characters. It really hit me on a personal level about loss and finding new family. Great game. Bravo
And no microtransactions.👍

I am so thankful there are developers still aiming to use native resolutions and not reconstruction techniques. I don’t care how good it looks I can always tell when it’s reconstructed 4K and I’m growing tired of games only using it.
Correct me if I'm wrong but isn't anything 4k pretty much useless anyway considering the human eye can't even take in detail after a certain point? Idk I personally would rather have the 60fps
Perfomance wise the engine is garbage. lol
waiting on a Digital Foundry video to cover the new Halo Infinite video 🙂

For consoles this gen is all about 
4K
30-60 FPS
HDR 
RT at 30FPS
Without RT at 60FPS

120FPS is more of a gimmick. Just like last gen 4K

I do suspect upgraded versions of PS5 & SX by 2023 or 2024. (They will be marketed as "dynamic" 8K consoles. Moreover the upgraded versions will do RT at 60FPS at 4K in most cases).
Played it half way in 60fps mode, switched to the quality mode and the 30fps is just horrible , feels like the screen rips apart when you move
Oh dear for Series S. That's pretty sad why they gimped it so much. One X could do better. Eidos wanted or were asked to keep clear daylight between SX/PS5 vs S etc
That quality/performance slider scene at 1:01 is fake - end of. When did 1080 ever for a second look like 240p.
Damn. I don't like this type of games but I have to admit it's gorgeous
I think Tom needs to go and look at the performance of Chapter 14 on Series X 💀
I have enjoyed the game so far on my Series S but its the only next gen console I've been able to get due to not wanting to pay scalping prices
Interesting how the difference between Series S and X is so minimal when I watch this on TV. Only when you sit up close you see a huge difference.
People called me a madman when I said 30fps would still stick around.
Series S should have been called Series Y, because Y would you buy it?
Wait, wasn't the whole point of next gen consoles the fact that we would start getting more 4K 60fps games? Why are we still being limited to 30fps in some games?
